content.webTitle: Emap buys public sector news service

fields.headline: Emap buys public sector news service
fields.bodyText: Emap today spent £18m on a subscription information business specialising in public sector news. The company's business-to-business division, Emap Communications, said it had paid for the London-based DeHavilland Information Services in cash. Emap said the acquisition was expected to boost earnings in its first full year, and the business had "exciting growth prospects". DeHavilland's internet service Public Affairs Briefing is the leading service of its type, and growing strongly in its market, Emap said. The company's crop of public sector magazines comprises Health Service Journal, Local Government Chronicle and Nursing Times. "DeHavilland is a very high quality subscription information business which will be an excellent addition to our public sector business," said Derek Carter, the chief executive of Emap Communications. "This is a good example of our strategy of bolt-on acquisitions for our B2B business." · To contact the MediaGuardian newsdesk email editor@mediatheguardian.com or phone 020 7239 9857 · If you are writing a comment for publication, please mark clearly "for publication".
